modules.description: This module supports AST transformations for wikitext documents through recursive mapping operations. It provides functions to process and modify block and inline elements, including handling tables, links, and normalization of text content. Specific use cases include generating and inserting tables of contents, converting links to HTML, and normalizing document structure during rendering or preprocessing.

This module defines core data types for representing structured wikitext documents, including block-level elements like ordered and unordered lists, term and description definitions, and table cells. It provides a `document` type as a list of blocks, enabling hierarchical document construction and traversal. Concrete use cases include parsing and rendering wikitext with structured elements like lists, definitions, and tables.

This module provides functions to parse wikitext from various input sources into structured documents and render them as HTML. It operates on the `document` type, which represents hierarchical block-level content such as lists, tables, and definitions. Use cases include converting wikitext files to HTML, programmatically modifying document structure, and normalizing content during rendering.
